fields_of_interest: Trade, Competition, Consumers, Education and training, Business and Industry, Single market, Public Health
eu_initiatives:
- We are currently liaising with DG GROW on possible consequences of the SCHEER report on sunbeds findings. We have agreed that the "information to the consumer" on risk and benefits of sunbed use could be further improved. ESA has recently made a proposal with 6 ideas on how to improve the EN60335-2-27 technical standard to that respect.     
 
- Together with CENELEC and the Austrian Standards Institute (ASI), ESA is now further implementing the EN16489-1 to 3 regarding the training of tanning facility staff and the provision of services by such facilities. Next to the UK we are now in the process of accreditation for training providers in The Netherlands (Oct. 2018). Austria and probably Hungary will come next.  
 
- ESA is closely following the review of national legislation in several European countries regarding professional sun bed use.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations

relevant_communication:
We have just launched a completely new website which you can find under: www.europeansunlight.eu 
 
The information on the new site provides all stakeholders with up-to-date information on professional sun bed use. It contains most recent information on standardization, legislation, research etc.
